content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here's a possible solution:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter!(word -> isupper(first(word)), words)
end
```

This function uses the `filter!` function from the Base library, which takes a predicate function and a collection and removes all elements that do not satisfy the predicate. In this case, the predicate function checks if the first character of a word is an uppercase letter by using the `isupper` function from the `Base` library.

Note that this function modifies the input `words` collection instead of creating a new one, so make sure to create a copy of the original collection if you need to preserve it.

Also, keep in mind that this function assumes that the input is a collection of strings. If the input can contain other types of elements, you may need to add additional type checks or error handling.
